title: Not everything that starts with a backslash is an escape sequence. Many characters are just not useful to escape sequences, and will simply cause a preceding backslash to be ignored.

inline_content.Text: Not everything that starts with a backslash is an escape sequence. Many characters are just not useful to escape sequences, and will simply cause a preceding backslash to be ignored.

title: A backslash at the end of a line inside a string does not introduce an escape sequence, but indicates line continuation, i.e.

title: While escape sequences in JavaScript bear resemblance to other languages and formats, like C++, Java, JSON, etc. there will often be critical differences in the details. When in doubt, be sure to test that your code behaves as expected, and consider checking the language specification.

inline_content.Text: While escape sequences in JavaScript bear resemblance to other languages and formats, like C++, Java, JSON, etc. there will often be critical differences in the details. When in doubt, be sure to test that your code behaves as expected, and consider checking the language specification.

title: Entering special characters in strings and regular expressions

var str = "ポケモン"; // a valid string
var regExp = /[Α-Ωα-ω]/; // matches any Greek letter without diacritics

title: Some escape sequences consist of a backslash followed by a single character.

title: For example, in
alert("Hello\nWorld");
c
, the escape sequence
\n
c
is used to introduce a newline in the string parameter, so that the words “Hello” and “World” are displayed in consecutive lines.

title: Unicode escape sequences with curly braces only work inside strings, not inside regular expressions!

inline_content.Text: Unicode escape sequences with curly braces only work inside strings, not inside regular expressions!

title: Octal escape sequences are deprecated as of ES5, but they are still supported inside regular expressions and in non-strict mode also inside non-template strings. An octal escape sequence consists of one, two or three octal digits, with value between 0 and 3778 = 255.

inline_content.Text: Octal escape sequences are deprecated as of ES5, but they are still supported inside regular expressions and in non-strict mode also inside non-template strings. An octal escape sequence consists of one, two or three octal digits, with value between 0 and 3778 = 255.
